symptoms.name: Rhinitis (snuffles)
symptoms.pattern: Usually develops in the 2nd-3rd week of life; may be the earliest clinical sign

symptoms.name: Maculopapular rash
symptoms.pattern: On palms and soles, may be associated with desquamation; can be widespread

symptoms.name: Bullous eruption (pemphigus syphiliticus)
symptoms.pattern: On palms and soles, superficial erosions and blisters

symptoms.name: Cutaneous lesions
symptoms.pattern: Visible from birth on palms and soles, erosions with moist, erythematous base in acral distribution, perianal moist erythematous lesion, cheilitis

symptoms.name: Congenital pneumonia (pneumonia alba)
symptoms.pattern: Diffuse, uniform opacification of both lungs on chest X-ray

symptoms.name: Jaundice
symptoms.pattern: Elevations of both conjugated and unconjugated bilirubin

symptoms.name: Irritability
symptoms.pattern: Aggravated by touch, suggestive of pseudoparalysis

physical_findings: Bullous eruption on palms and soles
Erythematous skin, mild edema, prominent desquamation of fingers
Superficial erosions and blisters on feet
Tachypnea, chest retractions, decreased breath sounds, crackles, cyanosis, grunting, glue-like secretions

imaging_findings.Chest X-ray: Diffuse, uniform opacification of both lungs (pneumonia alba)
imaging_findings.Long bone X-ray: Increased radiolucency, widening, irregularity, and erosions in the metaphyseal regions of the long bones
imaging_findings.Cerebral MRI: Periventricular leukomalacia and possible petechial hemorrhages

required: Positive non-treponemal serologic test (e.g., RPR, VDRL)
supportive: Characteristic clinical findings (e.g., rhinitis, rash, hepatomegaly)
Abnormal laboratory values (e.g., anemia, thrombocytopenia, elevated liver enzymes)

differential_diagnoses: Acrodermatitis due to vitamin or nutrient deficiency
